alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 10:57AM PDT until March 28 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...In western Modoc County, heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. For the rest of Modoc County, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting to around 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...For the warning area, Western Modoc County including Tionesta, Day and portions of Highway 139 northwest of Canby. For the Advisory, this includes portions of central and eastern Modoc County including Canby, Lookout as well as areas near and over the Warner Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is expected late tonight through Tuesday morning. Snowfall rates could approach 1 inch per hour tonight through Tuesday morning. The combination of strong winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities and occasional whiteout conditions. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
